result.execSummary:
The defendant Tasha Marie Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>10-50g), a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)3.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety with the exception of prescribed medications.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with K.H., D.L. and R.B.Z.

Comply with the Drug Court Program.

Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both. 

Complete GED/HSED.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Huber Law, to commence immediately.

Spend an additional three hundred fifty-nine (359) days in the county jail, under the Huber Law, stayed and to be imposed at the agent's discretion and upon order of the Court.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tasha Marie Harris

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on May 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
It is hereby ordered the cash bond in 22 CF 153 is reduced from a $2,000.00 cash bond to a $1,000.00 cash bond.

11:31 AM Defendant Tasha Marie Harris appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Philip L Hoff for Tasha Marie Harris appeared by video, Attorney Angelina R Scarpelli for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail. Parties argue. 
The court modifies the bail to $1,000 cash bond with the same non-monetary conditions. 
Attorney Hoff to draft the order.
AMENDED Commitment for Failure to Furnish $1,000 Cash BaIL
Motion for Bail Modification.
Scheduling conference on May 4, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Further proceedings on April 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Zoom appearances.
Defendant in custody in Manitowoc County Jail.
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 04-08-22
Scheduling conference is set for 05-04-22 at 10:15 a.m.
Bail motion is set for 03-09-22 at 11:00 a.m.
Minutes.
Bail/bond hearing on March 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Philip Hoff, through Public Defender.

Defendant in custody.    
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 03-04-22 at 1:30 p.m.   Court denies defendant's request to modify bail.   
Minutes.
Letter from defendant requesting bail modification

ADDRESS INFO for Tasha Marie Harris
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 02-24-2022)
Prior: 1617 S 10Th St, Manitowoc, WI 54220
RE:  Possess methamphetamine with intent to deliver as repeater.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.
Order for Prints.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess methamphetamine with intent to deliver and possess drug paraphernalia.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-28-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 cash with the conditions that she have no contact with Daniel Lowery and Renee VanZon and maintain absolute sobriety.    Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
